alert.note: Alert for Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 24 at 1:27PM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALBANY AND SOUTHWESTERN LARAMIE COUNTIES... At 126 PM MST...A snow squall was along a line extending from near Federal to near The Buttes...and moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 35 mph and visibilities less than one half mile along Interstate 80 between Cheyenne and Laramie. SOURCE...Radar and Webcams. IMPACT...Hazardous travel conditions due to slick roads and low visibilities. Locations impacted include... North Crow Campground, Granite Springs Reservoir, Vedauwoo, Federal, Tie Siding, Granite Springs Campground, Crystal Lake Reservoir, Pumpkin Vine, Crystal Lake Campground, Vedauwoo Campground, Buford and The Buttes. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 326 and 353. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Expect rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Motorists are urged to use extreme caution if traveling through these areas!

area.areaDesc: Laramie Valley; South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
